name: df-covers
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3
body: |- wceq(ccvr, cmpt(s0, universe, copab(s1, s2, w3a(wa(wcel(cv(s1), cfv(cbs, cv(s0))), wcel(cv(s2), cfv(cbs, cv(s0)))), wbr(cv(s1), cfv(cplt, cv(s0)), cv(s2)), wn(wrex(s3, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wa(wbr(cv(s1), cfv(cplt, cv(s0)), cv(s3)), wbr(cv(s3), cfv(cplt, cv(s0)), cv(s2)))))))))
bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ <o =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶ { < s1, s2 > |((s1 ‚àà(Base ` s0)‚àß s2 ‚àà(Base ` s0))‚àß s1[(lt ` s0)]s2 ‚àß ¬¨ ‚àÉ(s3 ‚àà(Base ` s0),(s1[(lt ` s0)]s3 ‚àß s3[(lt ` s0)]s2)))})
comment: Define the covers relation ("is covered by") for posets. " ` a ` is covered by ` b ` " means that ` a ` is strictly less than ` b ` and there is nothing in between. See ~ cvrval for the relation form. (Contributed by NM, 18-Sep-2011.)
